Pre-Game Insights: Riley Greene, Colt Keith, Zach McKinstry, Parker Meadows, and Jace Jung have combined for 12 hits in the series for the Tigers.
The A’s have compiled 21 hits in the series, led by Lawrence Butler and Brent Rooker with four apiece.
The Tigers have gone just 4-for-29 with runners in scoring position, leaving 22 runners on base.
The A’s have failed on 17 opportunities (8-for-25) with runners in scoring position, leaving 17 runners on base.
Tarik Skubal, born in Hayward, took a no-decision on Friday but looks forward to his Coliseum memories.
J.T. Ginn will start the final game of the club’s second-to-last homestand.
Jacob Wilson, a top prospect, has three hits in his past two starts at shortstop.
A’s manager Mark Kotsay noted that Wilson’s clock is pretty good in terms of game speed.
